meanings.definition: Move in a slow, heavy, awkward way.
meanings.sent1: The bear lumbers through the forest, searching for food.
meanings.sent2: He lumbers along the path, his heavy backpack slowing him down.
meanings.sent3: The elephant lumbers around the circus ring, trying to balance on a ball.
meanings.sent4: The old car lumbers down the road, coughing and sputtering.
meanings.sent5: The giant robot lumbers through the city, causing chaos wherever it goes.

meanings.definition: Timber sawn into rough planks or otherwise prepared for use in building.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter stacked the lumbers neatly in the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The lumbers were used to build a sturdy fence around the garden.
meanings.sent3: The children built a fort out of lumbers they found in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The lumbers from the old barn were repurposed to make a new table.
meanings.sent5: The lumbers at the lumberyard were all different sizes and shapes.
